intro: Draba healyi, commonly known as Healy's whitlow grass, is a flowering plant species native to the western United States. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. This plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, often in areas with well-drained soil. Draba healyi produces small, white or pale yellow flowers during the spring and summer months. Its leaves are usually basal, forming a rosette, and the plant is adapted to withstand cold and arid conditions.
